intro: Rhinanthus lintonii, commonly known as the Linton's yellow rattle, is a flowering plant native to the British Isles. It is a member of the Orobanchaceae family, characterized by its parasitic relationship with grasses. The plant produces showy, orange-yellow flowers that bloom from June to August. It typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as chalk downs and grasslands. Rhinanthus lintonii plays an important role in supporting pollinators and maintaining biodiversity in its native ecosystems.
